title: Warp-Touched Dagger
description: Description: A simple dagger infused with barely perceptible warp energy. It grants unnatural precision and pierces armor with ease. Grants +5% WS and ignores 1 AP. On a natural 01-05 to hit, the dagger channels Warp energy uncontrollably, dealing 1 automatic Wound to the wielder

title: Whispering Trinket
description: Description: A small metal charm covered in shifting Chaos symbols that whisper in the wind, offering unpredictable insight. Each morning, the wearer rolls 1d6:
1-2: +5% Perception
3-4: +5% Intelligence
5-6: +5% Fellowship

title: Slaanesh’s Perfume
description: Description: An intoxicating perfume that enhances the wearer’s presence. Grants +10 FEL for 1 hour, and those within 2 squares feel an unnatural attraction toward the wearer. However, once it wears off, the user must pass a WP Test (-10%) or suffer from withdrawal for 1d10 hours. During this time, all social interactions feel shallow and meaningless.

title: Soul Quencher
description: Description: A single glove, soft yet oddly spongy. It enhances grip strength but carries the stench of decay. Grants +10% to Strength-based tests, but NPCs within 1 square suffer -5 Fellowship when interacting with the wearer.

title: Tzeentch’s Candle
description: Description: A candle that burns in unnatural hues, flickering even without wind. When lit, it reveals all invisible creatures and magical auras within a 5-square radius. The candle lasts for 1 hour per use.

title: Bloodbound Axe
description: Description: A brutal axe that vibrates with a hunger for battle, seeking the blood of its enemies. Grants +10% WS while injured and deals +1 damage. If the wielder is at 50% HP or lower, they must pass a WP Test (-10%) or attack the nearest enemy.

title: Oracle Mask
description: Description: An unsettling mask that grants glimpses of possible futures but twists reality slightly each time. Once per day, the wearer may reroll one failed test. On a roll of 96-100, the result is altered in an unpredictable way.

title: Daemon-Clawed Boots
description: Description: Boots of unnatural grace and movement, making the wearer near silent. Grants +10 Agility and allows the wearer to land without sound.

title: Rotheart Pendant
description: Description: A pulsing, fleshy pendant that dulls pain and grants unnatural resilience. Grants +10 Toughness, and the wearer may ignore the effects of light wound (1 damage). However, their flesh becomes unresponsive, making wounds close improperly (-1 incoming healing).

title: Warpsteel Bracers
description: Description: Metal bands that shift in color and strengthen in chaos. Grants +1 AP when surrounded by 2+ enemies. Roll 1d10 on activation;
1-3: Uncontrollable surge (no dodge 'till next turn);
4-7: Normal function;
8-10: Overcharge for +1 extra AP.

title: Claymore of the Ever-Hungry
description: Description: Attacks are now regarded as ''Impact'' quality. On a kill, the wielder heals 1W and use free action to enter ''Rage'', but must pass a WP Test (-10%) or enter a blood rage, attacking the nearest living creature (friend or foe) for 1 round. Rage: Grants +10 bonus to control effects and +1 damage to all attacks while raging.

title: Cloak of the Abyss
description: Description: A writhing cloak of chitin and shadow, infused with chaotic will. Once per session, summon abyssal limbs to attack or defend:
- Attack: Strike an adjacent target using Weapon Skill, dealing 1d10+3 Damage (ignores 1 AP).
- Defend: Force an enemy to reroll a successful melee attack once per round.

title: Perfectionist's Blade
description: Description: Enemies within 3 squares must pass a CHallenging WP Test (-10%) or waste their first action admiring the blade. The wielder must pass a WP Test (-10% per week of wielding it) or become obsessed with polishing and admiring the sword, suffering -10% WS if forced to use another weapon.

title: Daemonfire Gauntlet
description: Description: Twice per day, the wielder may unleash a 3-square cone of plaguefire. All within must pass a Toughness Test (-20%) or suffer -1 Wound per round [ignoring armor/toughness] for 3 rounds. After each use, the wielder’s hand rots slightly, requiring a WP Test (-10%) or they lose fine motor control for 1 hour.

title: Warp-Wreathed Crown
description: Description: A pulsating crown that grants visions of power. Provides +10 Intelligence and allows the wearer to speak Daemonic tongues. Once per week, the wearer may ask a single yes/no question and receive an answer from a Daemon.

title: The Crimson Crown
description: Description: The wearer gains +1 melee attack per turn. If removed, the wearer must immediately attack whoever took it off.

title: Flesh-Twisting Armor
description: Description: This living armor fuses with the wearer’s skin. Grants +3 AP (full) and makes the wearer immune to disease and poison, but every week, the wearer grows a new, unpredictable mutation. Once the wearer gains 3 mutations, they must pass a WP Test (-20%) or become enslaved to Nurgle’s will.

title: The Ever-Shifting Blade
description: Description: A sword of ever-changing metal, reshaping mid-swing to adapt to its enemy’s weaknesses. It automatically adjusts to bypass enemy armor.

title: Mirror of Slannesh
description: Description: A flawless obsidian mirror that whispers praise to its owner, showing them their "true form." Grants +15 Fellowship, +10 Charm. Once per day, force a target within 5 squares to pass a WP Test (-20%) or become charmed for 1d3 rounds.

title: The Doom Bell
description: Description: Once per day, the wielder may toll the bell, forcing all enemies within 10 squares to take a Challenging Terror Test [-10%]. Each time the bell rings, the wielder must pass a WP Test (-10%) or suffer visions of their own death, imposing -5% WP and -5 Initiative until the next session.

title: Blade of the Dark Gods
description: Description: A daemonic blade, thirsty for endless slaughter. It whispers of grand battles and eternal war. Grants +3 DMG and causes unstoppable bleeding wounds on critical hits.

title: Deck of the Changer
description: Description: A deck of possbilities, its colors twisting impossibly. A mysterious deck of ivory or vellum cards, numbering 13 or 22. When drawn, each card triggers a powerful and unpredictable magical effect, often altering fate itself. Cards vanish after use, save for a few trickster cards that may return. The deck is known to bring fortune or ruin in equal measure.

title: The Famine Heart
description: Description: A dried, shriveled heart that still beats. As the bearer carries it, their body slowly withers, but they feel no hunger, thirst, or fatigue and gains +1 AP (all). However, each week, they must pass a WP Test (-10%) or permanently lose 1 Wound from their maximum. When the wielder reaches 0 Wounds, they become a mindless husk.

title: The Silk of Awakening
description: Description: The wearer’s senses are heightened, boosting sense-related tests by +30, also wearer gains ''Supernatural Allure'' Talent. However, while worn, all damage (even minor scratches) feels euphoric, forcing another WP Test (-10%) to avoid recklessly pursuing more self-harm or conflict.

title: Primordial Mask of Knowledge
description: Description: A spiked black crown that grants ultimate knowledge… at a price. It grants +20 Intelligence and allows the wearer to know the answer to one question once per day. After each use, permanently reduce Fellowship by -5% as the wearer becomes too alien in demeanor or cryptic to interact normally.
